description.value:
This element just holds data to express the actionEvent to fire. This element
should always be the child of a n-action-activator.

attributes.name: command
attributes.description: The command to execute.

attributes.name: topic
attributes.description: This is the topic this action-command is targeting.

description.value:
This element defines how or when a group of actions are
activated. The actions activated must be included between
this elements tags.

attributes.name: activate
attributes.description: The activation strategy to use for the contained actions.

attributes.name: debug
attributes.description: Turn on debug statements for load, update and render events.

attributes.name: once
attributes.description:
Limit the activation to ONCE. This could be helpful if an action
has side-effects if it is run multiple times.

Note: the activation
state is stored in memory and does not persist across refreshes.

attributes.name: target-element
attributes.description:
The element or elements to watch for events when using the OnElementEvent
activation strategy. This element uses the HTML Element querySelectorAll
function to find the element/s based on the query in this attribute.

If left blank, this element looks for child elements matching:
'a,button,input[type=button]'

For use with activate="on-element-event" and "at-time"

attributes.name: target-event
attributes.description:
This is the name of the event/s to listen to on the target element
separated by comma.

attributes.name: time
attributes.description:
The time, in seconds at which the contained actions should be submitted.

For use with activate="at-time" Only!

description.value:
This component enables app services. These are console logging
theming and event-delegation as well as a plugin system to
manage a UI kit to add components like Modals, Drawers,
menus, etc. The basic provider is used to toggle dark-mode.

attributes.name: debug
attributes.description:
Turn on debugging to get helpful messages from the
app, routing, data and action systems.

attributes.name: disable-actions
attributes.description:
Turn off declarative actions for the entire
app.

description.value:
This component serves as a proxy to delegate event-based
functions to be consumed by various analytics snippets.

This component leverages the browser's web-share
API to give the application a native-app feel.

attributes.name: headline
attributes.description: Headline for the share

attributes.name: text
attributes.description: The textual body of web share

attributes.name: url
attributes.description: The URL we are sharing

description.value:
This component checks for the preferred light/dark theme preference of the
user and sets the ui state: theme, accordingly.

attributes.name: dark-class
attributes.description:
Change the class name that is added to the
body tag when the theme is determined to
be dark.

attributes.name: skip-class
attributes.description:
Skip adding the class to the body tag, just
update the ui state.

description.value:
This component displays a checkbox to control the
dark-theme setting applied to the ui.

Default: user-preference

attributes.name: classes
attributes.description: The class to add to the inner input.

attributes.name: input-id
attributes.description: The inner input ID

description.value:
Use this element only once per page to enable audio features.
It will add a CDN reference to Howler.js:
<https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/howler@2.2.1/dist/howler.core.min.js>

attributes.name: data-provider
attributes.description:
Experimental support for providing audio-data in the
data-provider system.

attributes.name: debug
attributes.description:
Use debug for verbose logging. Useful for figuring
thing out.

attributes.name: display
attributes.description:
The display mode enabled shows player state and stats.
No track information or duration is be displayed.

attributes.name: howler-version
attributes.description: The Howler.js Script Reference

description.value:
This element represents an action to be fired. This
specialized action encapsulates required parameters
needed for audio-based actions, for music.

attributes.name: command
attributes.description: The command to execute.

attributes.name: topic
attributes.description: Readonly topic

attributes.name: track-id
attributes.description: The track to target.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value payload for the command.

description.value:
This component declares audio used within this \<n-view-prompt\> route.
The \<n-audio-action-sound-load\> instructs the player to load audio files
while defining play behaviors.

The audio player will pre-load or play when the route is active.
The player manages them according to their settings.

attributes.name: defer-load
attributes.description:
If set, disables auto-rendering of this instance.
To fetch the contents change to false or remove
attribute.

attributes.name: discard
attributes.description: The discard strategy the player should use for this file.

attributes.name: loop
attributes.description: Set this to true to have the audio file loop.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description:
This is loading strategy that determines
what is should do after the file is retrieved.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: The path to the audio-file.

attributes.name: track-id
attributes.description: The identifier for this music track

description.value:
This element represents an action to be fired. This
specialized action encapsulates required parameters
needed for audio-based actions, for music.

attributes.name: command
attributes.description: The command to execute.

attributes.name: topic
attributes.description: Readonly topic

attributes.name: track-id
attributes.description: The track to target.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value payload for the command.

description.value:
This component declares audio used within this \<n-view-prompt\> route.
The \<n-audio-action-sound-load\> instructs the player to load audio files
while defining play behaviors.

The audio player will pre-load or play when the route is active.
The player manages them according to their settings.

attributes.name: defer-load
attributes.description:
If set, disables auto-rendering of this instance.
To fetch the contents change to false or remove
attribute.

attributes.name: discard
attributes.description: The discard strategy the player should use for this file.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description:
This is loading strategy that determines
what is should do after the file is retrieved.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: The path to the audio-file.

attributes.name: track-id
attributes.description: The identifier for this music track

description.value: This component exposes a checkbox to enable or disable global audio for background sounds and video.

attributes.name: classes
attributes.description: Any classes to add to the input-element directly.

attributes.name: data-provider
attributes.description: The data provider to store the audio state in.

attributes.name: input-id
attributes.description: The id field to add to the input-element directly.

attributes.name: setting
attributes.description: Which state property this switch controls.

description.value:
This component fetches remote HTML and renders it safely and directly
into the page when when and where you tell it too, as soon as it renders.

attributes.name: defer-load
attributes.description:
If set, disables auto-rendering of this instance.
To fetch the contents change to false or remove
attribute.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: Cross Origin Mode

attributes.name: resolve-tokens
attributes.description:
Before rendering HTML, replace any data-tokens with their
resolved values. This also commands this component to
re-render it's HTML for data-changes. This can affect
performance.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: Remote Template URL

attributes.name: when
attributes.description:
A data-token predicate to advise this component when
to render (useful if used in a dynamic route or if
tokens are used in the 'src' attribute)

description.value:
This component converts markdown text to HTML. It can render
from an inline-template or from a remote source.

attributes.name: defer-load
attributes.description:
If set, disables auto-rendering of this instance.
To fetch the contents change to false or remove
attribute.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: Cross Origin Mode

attributes.name: no-cache
attributes.description: Force render with data & route changes.

attributes.name: resolve-tokens
attributes.description:
Before rendering HTML, replace any data-tokens with their
resolved values. This also commands this component to
re-render it's HTML for data-changes. This can affect
performance.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: Remote Template URL

attributes.name: when
attributes.description:
A data-token predicate to advise this component when
to render (useful if used in a dynamic route or if
tokens are used in the 'src' attribute)

description.value:
This component makes a single reference to script and css sources. It can
be used by HTML fragment to ensure a reference is made, without worry
that it will create duplicate references.

attributes.name: defer-load
attributes.description:
If set, disables auto-rendering of this instance.
To fetch the contents change to false or remove
attribute.

attributes.name: inline
attributes.description:
When inline the link/script tags are rendered in-place
rather than added to the head.

attributes.name: module
attributes.description: Import the script file as a module.

attributes.name: no-module
attributes.description:
Declare the script only for use when
modules aren't supported

attributes.name: script-src
attributes.description: The script file to reference.

attributes.name: style-src
attributes.description: The css file to reference

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description:
Timeout (in milliseconds) to wait for the references
to load.

description.value:
This tag renders a template for each item in the configured array.
The item template uses value expressions to insert data from any
data provider as well as the item in the array.

attributes.name: debug
attributes.description: Turn on debug statements for load, update and render events.

attributes.name: defer-load
attributes.description:
If set, disables auto-rendering of this instance.
To fetch the contents change to false or remove
attribute.

attributes.name: filter
attributes.description:
The JSONata query to filter the json items
see <https://try.jsonata.org> for more info.

attributes.name: items
attributes.description:
The array-string or data expression to obtain a collection for rendering the template.
{{session:cart.items}}

attributes.name: items-src
attributes.description: The URL to remote JSON collection to use for the items.

attributes.name: no-cache
attributes.description: Force render with data & route changes.

attributes.name: when
attributes.description:
A data-token predicate to advise this component when
to render (useful if used in a dynamic route or if
tokens are used in the 'src' attribute)

description.value:
Use this component to add a little flair to any HTML.
It creates an entrance animation using the configured
attributes to add pop to any page.

attributes.name: animation-distance
attributes.description: How far the element moves in the animation (% of element width/height)

attributes.name: delay
attributes.description: How long to delay the animation (ms)

attributes.name: direction
attributes.description: Direction the element moves when animating in

attributes.name: duration
attributes.description: How long the animation runs (ms)

attributes.name: trigger-distance
attributes.description: How much of the element must be visible before it animates (% of element height)

description.value:
This element conditionally renders child elements based on the
configured predicate applied to the when value predicate.
To learn more about predicates, check out the
expressions documentation.

attributes.name: when
attributes.description:
The data expression to obtain a predicate for conditionally rendering
the inner-contents of this element.

description.value:
Render data directly into HTML using declarative expressions.
This element renders the expression with all data-tokens
replaced with the values provided by the provider.

attributes.name: defer-load
attributes.description:
If set, disables auto-rendering of this instance.
To fetch the contents change to false or remove
attribute.

attributes.name: text
attributes.description:
The data expression to obtain a value for rendering as inner-text for this element.
{{session:user.name}}

description.value:
This element enables the Data Provider system. It hosts
the action-listener that registers providers.  Add this tag
to that page to enable token-replacement.

attributes.name: provider-timeout
attributes.description:
The wait-time, in milliseconds to wait for
un-registered data providers found in an expression.
This is to accommodate a possible lag between
evaluation before the first view-do 'when' predicate
an the registration process.

description.value:
This component enables the *Cookie Data Provider*,
after requesting consent from the user. The consent
message and the accept/reject button are customizable.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Provider name to use in nent expressions.

attributes.name: skip-consent
attributes.description:
When skipConsent is true, the accept-cookies banner will not
be displayed before accessing cookie-data.

description.value:
This component enables the **Session Data Provider**.
It leverages the short-lived browser storage.

attributes.name: key-prefix
attributes.description: The key prefix to use in storage

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Provider name to use in nent expressions.

description.value:
This component enables the **Storage Data Provider**, that
leverages the browser 'long-term' data storage.

attributes.name: key-prefix
attributes.description: The key prefix to use in storage

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Provider name to use in nent expressions.

description.value:
This element enables element manipulation through n-actions.
Add it to the page to perform actions like 'add-css', toggle
attributes or to execute functions on the DOM without code.

attributes.name: debug
attributes.description: Turn on debug statements for load, update and render events.

description.value:
This component encapsulates a timed presentation. This component uses
a child n-presentation-timer or n-video element to create time-events
then it delegates those events to time-based action-activators.

If enabled, the n-attributes for time will also get processed. This
component also has the ability to go to the next route using the active
route's 'goNext' function.

attributes.name: analytics
attributes.description:
Send analytics view-time percentages for this presentation
using the event name

attributes.name: debug
attributes.description: To debug timed elements, set this value to true.

attributes.name: next-after
attributes.description:
Go to the next view after a given time if a number
is present, otherwise when the end-event occurs.

attributes.name: timer-element
attributes.description:
The element selector for the timer-element to
bind for interval events. If left blank, it looks
first an n-timer, then for the first n-video.

If none are found, it creates on manually and starts
it immediately

description.value:
This specialized action contains the time attribute,
allowing it to be activated directly within the n-presentation
element (no n-action-activator needed)

attributes.name: at-time
attributes.description: The time this should execute

attributes.name: command
attributes.description: The command to execute.

attributes.name: topic
attributes.description: This is the topic this action-command is targeting.

attributes.name: debug
attributes.description: To debug timed elements, set this value to true.

attributes.name: duration
attributes.description:
Duration before the timer stops and raises
the ended event. 0 = never

attributes.name: start
attributes.description: Timer start time.

description.value:
This component enables th UI services. These are typically
web component plug-ins to manage things like Modals, Drawers,
menus, etc. The basic provider is used to toggle dark-mode.

attributes.name: debug
attributes.description: To debug timed elements, set this value to true.

attributes.name: duration-property
attributes.description:
Provide the element property name that
holds the duration time in seconds.
Default is duration

attributes.name: end-event
attributes.description:
Provider the end event name.
Default is ended

attributes.name: target-element
attributes.description:
Provide the element selector for the media object that can provide
time-updates and media-end events.

attributes.name: time-event
attributes.description:
Provide the time-event name.
Default is timeupdate

attributes.name: time-property
attributes.description:
Provide the element property name that
holds the current time in seconds.
Default is currentTime

description.value:
This component displays a checkbox to control the autoplay setting,
used for video playback - as well as automatic navigation to the
next page, when a video ends. Default: enabled

attributes.name: classes
attributes.description: Any classes to add to the input-element directly.

attributes.name: data-provider
attributes.description: The data provider to store the audio-enabled state in.

attributes.name: input-id
attributes.description: The id field to add to the input-element directly.

description.value:
The View component holds a segment of content visible only when
a URL path matches. It defines a route and its content.
This provides the declarative mechanism
for in-page content/component routing by URL.

attributes.name: content-src
attributes.description: Remote URL for this Route's content.

attributes.name: debug
attributes.description: Turn on debug statements for load, update and render events.

attributes.name: exact
attributes.description:
The path for this route should only be matched
when it is exact.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description:
Cross Origin Mode if the content is pulled from
a remote location

attributes.name: page-title
attributes.description:
The title for this view. This is prefixed
before the app title configured in n-views

attributes.name: path
attributes.description:
The path for this route, including the parent's
routes, excluding the router's root.

attributes.name: resolve-tokens
attributes.description:
Before rendering remote HTML, replace any data-tokens with their
resolved values. This also commands this component to
re-render it's HTML for data-changes. This can affect
performance.

IMPORTANT: ONLY WORKS ON REMOTE HTML

attributes.name: scroll-top-offset
attributes.description:
Header height or offset for scroll-top on this
view.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description:
Remote URL for this route's HTML. HTML from this
URL will be not be assigned to any slot.

You can add slot='content' to any containers
within this HTML if you have a mix of HTML for
this exact-route and its children.

attributes.name: transition
attributes.description:
Navigation transition between routes.
This is a CSS animation class.

description.value:
The element should be used in-place of an `a` tag to navigate without
refreshing the page. This element supports an active-class that will
be applied when the route in **href** matches the route of the app.

This is helpful for displaying active routes in menus, bread-crumbs and tabs.

attributes.name: active-class
attributes.description:
The class to add when the matching route is active
in the browser

attributes.name: debug
attributes.description: Provide log messages for path matching.

attributes.name: exact
attributes.description:
Only active on the exact href match,
and not on child routes

attributes.name: path
attributes.description: The destination route for this link

attributes.name: strict
attributes.description:
Only active on the exact href match
using every aspect of the URL including
parameters.

description.value:
Display a list of routes related to the current route.
Modes:
**siblings**: all routes at the same depth level (nav)
**parents**: all parent routes. (breadcrumbs)
**children**: all child routes within a hierarchy. (sub-menu)

attributes.name: active-class
attributes.description: The active-class to use with the n-view-link components.

attributes.name: exclude-root
attributes.description:
Specify if the '/' route should
be skipped in the list.

attributes.name: item-class
attributes.description: The list-item-class to use with the li tag

attributes.name: list-class
attributes.description: The list-class to use with the UL tag

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The display mode for which routes to display.

description.value:
This component should be placed at the end of the content,
inside the n-views component. It shows up when no views
above it resolve.

attributes.name: page-title
attributes.description:
The title for this view. This is prefixed
before the app title configured in n-views

attributes.name: scroll-top-offset
attributes.description:
Header height or offset for scroll-top on this
view.

attributes.name: transition
attributes.description:
Navigation transition between routes.
This is a CSS animation class.

description.value:
This element represents a specialized child-route for a parent \<n-view\> component.
It represents a sub-route that has required and workflow behaviors.

They are used to create, wizards, input workflows, or step by step instructions or
wherever you want guided or automatic navigation.

attributes.name: content-src
attributes.description:
Remote URL for HTML content. Content from this
URL will be assigned the 'content' slot.

attributes.name: debug
attributes.description: To debug timed elements, set this value to true.

attributes.name: exact
attributes.description:
The url for this route should only be matched
when it is exact.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description:
Cross Origin Mode if the content is pulled from
a remote location

attributes.name: page-title
attributes.description:
The title for this view. This is prefixed
before the app title configured in n-views

attributes.name: path
attributes.description:
The path for this prompt route, including the parent's
routes, excluding the router's root.

attributes.name: resolve-tokens
attributes.description:
Before rendering remote HTML, replace any data-tokens with their
resolved values. This also commands this component to
re-render it's HTML for data-changes. This can affect
performance.

IMPORTANT: ONLY WORKS ON REMOTE HTML

attributes.name: scroll-top-offset
attributes.description:
Header height or offset for scroll-top on this
view.

attributes.name: transition
attributes.description:
Navigation transition between routes.
This is a CSS animation class.

attributes.name: visit
attributes.description:
The visit strategy for this do.
once: persist the visit and never force it again
always: do not persist, but don't don't show again in-session
optional: do not force this view-do ever. It will be available by URL

attributes.name: when
attributes.description:
If present, the expression must
evaluate to true for this route
to be sequenced by the parent view.
The existence of this value overrides
the visit strategy

description.value:
The root component is the base container for the view-engine and its
child components. This element should contain root-level HTML that
is global to every view along with \<n-view\>
components placed within any global-html.

attributes.name: app-title
attributes.description:
This is the application / site title.
If the views or dos have titles,
this is added as a suffix.

attributes.name: root
attributes.description:
This is the root path that the actual page is,
if it isn't '/', then the router needs to know
where to begin creating paths.

attributes.name: scroll-top-offset
attributes.description:
Header height or offset for scroll-top on this
and all views.

attributes.name: start-path
attributes.description:
This is the start path a user should
land on when they first land on this app.

attributes.name: transition
attributes.description:
Navigation transition between routes.
This is a CSS animation class.
